15.content:
"You're being hired to be the stunt double for..."

Shawn sat on the edge of the bed, his breath held, the phone pressed excitedly against his ear, as the seconds passed. "...for?"

Rebecca sounded reluctant as she spoke up. "Uh, well, it's a little more exotic than what we're used to. Are you sitting down for this?"

Shawn sighed and went about making his breakfast. "I'm a dog again, aren't I? Tell them thanks, but no thanks. But without the thanks," he said bitterly, recalling his time as a hockey-playing canine. As a stunt double, he was willing even eager to put himself through most dangers, but child actors wielding hockey sticks was now crossed off his list. After one too many blows to the head, he'd spent several hours wandering LA with a concussion, actually believing himself to be a dog, even eating garbage out of dumpsters.

"Relax! It's not a dog and the money is good. It's..."
15.title: Something else

151.content:
"Relax! It's not a dog and the money is good. It's a robot, okay? One of the studios is making a science fiction. They already had an engineering firm build them the robot they needed, only yesterday it... blew up. They're halfway through shooting the film and they need a replacement now otherwise the whole project is a write-off. That's why they're willing to pay so much! So, do you think you can do it? I mean, like, physically?"

Shawn poured himself a glass of orange juice. To be honest, he wasn't even sure himself - he'd never shapeshifted anything like a robot before. But the capability of his ability had never let him down before. "Sure, I can do it. It's not exactly what I had in mind when I came to Hollywood though. Great career prospects for this bucket of bolts, are there?"

"I know, hun," Rebecca soothed. "But this will be great for the agency - I mean rolling out a fully functional robot in less than a day? It's impossible! And what's great for the agency, is great for you. After all, you are my only client. So you're in? For me?"

"I'm in."

"Great! I'm emailing you the technical specifications now, and telling them filming can resume tomorrow! Seeya then!"

"One thing," he spoke up, grabbing his cornflakes and wandering over to his laptop. "What's the name of the film?"
151.title: A robot

choices: He's playing an early prototype exterminator
1512.content:
"Exterminator 3: Robot Revenge."

"Seriously? That's fantastic!" The Exterminator franchise was one of the biggest money spinners in Hollywood, a rather schlocky sci-fi tale of an ex-marine sent forward in time to fight robots in a post-apocalyptic wasteland, elevated mostly by its pioneering visual effects.

"I know, right! Anyway, I gotta go, talk to you later."

"I will return," Shawn chuckled, quoting the immortal line in the star's thick German accent.

"Har har, funny."

With that knowledge, Shawn relaxed a little. The Exterminator robots, like the E-800 and the E-1000, were humanoid cyborgs, metal skeletons wrapped in human skin. As such, shapeshifting one should pose no problem. The laptop finished booting and he clicked through to the the email Rebecca had sent, downloaded the ream of attachments - photographs, videos, technical specifications...

"Oh..."
1512.title: Exterminator 3: Robot Revenge

choices: Pick of Rebecca on the way
15121.content:
The Exterminator he would be playing was not humanoid, not even close. It was an earlier model, a prototype, the E-1. It had a flattened upper body like a crab, and stood on four anthropod legs. The front of the carapace had a single, glowing, red eye, either side of which were set two heavy machine guns. Beneath those were two mean-looking metal claw hands.

Shawn ran his fingers through his hair anxiously. This could be more of a challenge. He had tried shapeshifting an inanimate object only once before and handle found the experience particularly enjoyable. This thing was a monstrosity and he was going to be expected to maintain his form for hours, maybe even days at a time, depending on what happened to him between shoots.

With some trepidation he continued through the attached files until reaching one labelled 'set_accident.mpg'. It was a recording of the last scene filmed. The set had been expertly made up as a post-apocalyptic landscape, crumbling buildings, smoke and flames. As he watched, the star of the film and a young actress sprinted out of one of the buildings. A moment later, the E-1 appeared in the doorway, chasing them, it's twin miniguns spraying underwhelming, pre-production sparks.

Shawn really had to admire the animatronic work - the E-1 moved with amazing fluidity, it's four legs scuttling in perfect unison. All up until it stopped responding to controls. Halfway out of the door, the robot froze. There were shouts from the crew but it was too late; the pyrotechnics went up and the building came down, burying $3,000,000 of advanced animatronics under tonnes of rubble and reducing it to scrap metal.

The remainder of the footage was of the director going ballistic.

He spent the rest of the morning familiarizing himself with the schematics. They were baffling complex and detailed. While a machine was technically orders of magnitude simpler than a human body, shapeshifting them was second nature to him. Forming servomotors and hydraulics and CPUs was a different thing entirely. But eventually he was comfortable to give it a first try. Only he doubted his small flat could accommodate a 7 foot tall robots. He'd need somewhere with plenty of space and secluded. He went for a drive.
15121.title: He's playing an early prototype exterminator

15122.content:
"Oh... They went down that avenue? Honestly..."

The titular Exterminator of Exterminator 2: End Times had been a mechanical shapeshifter that had pursued John Conrad relentlessly, morphing its liquid metal body into blades to brutally kill anyone in its way. It was a truly terrifying, seemingly-unstoppable bad guy that even today gave Shawn the chills.

This was not that. This was the sexed up version. Neither the liquid metal nor skeletal versions, this new model more resembled a store window mannequin, with a distinctly female chassis - flared hips, slender limbs, and breasts. Way to pander to the lonely nerd demographic, Shawn sighed to himself. He flicked through some more of the attached photographs, but none looked particularly terrifying, or any less sexualised.

'The E-X Exterminatrix is the latest and most advanced of Cloudnet's deadly Exterminator units,' read one of the press releases. 'After our hero, John Conrad, was returned to the 21st century at the end of Exterminator 2, he thought the nightmare was over. Little did he know that the scattered remnants of Cloudnet had one last trick up its sleeve - the Exterminatrix. Sent back in time with a deadly arsenal of futuristic weaponry, not least of all its ability to holographically mimic any human, the Exterminatrix will not stop until it fulfills its primary objective - to kill John Conrad!'

"This sounds really dumb." Even the footage of the animatonics in action, prior to its untimely explosion, was lame. It could barely stand, let alone walk, and the arm movements looked like something out of Chuck E. Cheese.

Loading up the schematics, Shawn resolved himself. As a fan of the franchise, he was going to make this part his own. When they saw his Exterminatrix, they'd be wetting themselves in aisles with fear.
15122.title: Exterminatrix

choices: Shawn feels like a woman mostly
151221.content:
So now, Shawn decided to try the form of the Exterminatrix on for size. "Exterminate!" he jokingly quoted the catchphrase of the Exterminators as he examined the photo of the female killer robot again.

http://anonym.to/?http://www.omega-level...

With the image fresh in his mind, Shawn shapeshifted into the form of the Terminatrix. Seconds later this stood in his place.

Examining the image in the mirror Shawn began to assess how he felt about the situation.
151221.title: Practicing the form

1512212.content:
Shawn felt very much like a robot. The engineers had done an exceptional job making the external shell look like a nerd's wet dream using only lycra, fabric paint, and foam, but internally things were a different story. Being a human was something you only missed when you were no longer one, and the absence of breathing or a heartbeat unnerved him. A chill ran through him as his body heat began to leach out into the surroundings.

This form felt weird, alien, inhuman, and he recalled more clearly why he'd never repeated his foray into inanimate shapeshifting. He tried some simple movements; his limbs responded sluggishly, moved slowly. A simple step sent his metal body thudding hard to the floor.

He looked like a marionette operated by an inexperienced puppeteer as he climbed awkwardly to his feet. This wouldn't do at all. He focused his power internally, giving himself a tune-up - tightening up hydraulics, loosening joints, improving signal pathways. He wasn't aware of it, but soon his body was a specimen of robotics decades ahead of current technology. He flexed his fingers experimentally - found the motion fluid enough for him to almost convince himself he was still human.

Next he focused on the external dressing. The metallic painted lycra wrapped around his robot skeleton just looked tacky.

"We'll soon have th-"

---------------

"-at improved. What the..."

For him, the transition was instantaneous. One moment he was standing in his apartment, the next he was splayed out on the floor. He sat bolt upright, disorientated. "What the- Where the-" He stared around him. He was in his cousin's apartment. Staring down at himself, he discovered he was still in the body of the Exterminatrix and that a thick, black cable had been jammed into a socket in his navel. It was an invasive sensation having it in him, and he instinctively moved to pull it out.

"Don't touch it!" Rebecca shouted, running towards him. "You'll only shut yourself down again." She pulled him into a hug. He felt her human warmth spread through him a little from the contact. "Thank God you're alright," she said with relief.

"What happened? "Shut myself down"? "Again"?"

"I found you out cold in your apartment," she explained. "You idiot; you completely drained your battery, deactivated yourself. You could have been stolen, sold for scrap, God knows what! I had to bring you back to my apartment. Then I spent all night running round LA trying to get my hands on the right charger. Eventually I managed to contact one of the engineers who built the original...you."

He was indeed in her apartment. The floor around him was strewn with a multitude of phone chargers, laptop adapters, dongles, and even a pair of jumper cables. Outside, night has fallen, while to him it had been daylight only a minute ago.

A chill ran through him as he processed her words. For several hours, he'd been without power. Dead. If it hadn't been for her he would have stayed that way, forever, just an inanimate, mechanical... thing.

"What were you doing before you passed out?" she asked concerned.

"Just using my power," he replied. "I mean, my ability. It must really sap my batteries."

"You should probably go easy on using it until shooting is over then," Rebecca said. "We can't risk you shutting down everywhere."
1512212.title: Shawn feels lie...uh...a robot

choices: He's face down in Becky's carpet
He's in a crate being shipped to the studio
15122121.content:
It had never even occurred to him that shapeshifting a form with a power source would limit him to that power source. So now he was being powered by something that resembled a car battery. He prodded delicately at the cable inserted into his torso. "This feels really weird. How long is this going to take?"

"Only one way to find out," I'm afraid. She flipped open her laptop, selected a long line of ethernet cable from among the dongles, and plugged it in. Then she was advancing on him, holding the other end of the cable. "This might feel a bit odd too," she apologised, sliding it with a click into a concealed port hidden beneath his "hair" at the base of his neck.

"Understatement," Shawn winced. It was like somebody had drilled a hole in the back of his skull and was staring at his thought. He could... "hear" the laptop talking to his body and it responding

"Battery is at five percent," Becca said as data flashed across the laptop screen. "You'll need at least a few hours to charge."

"A few hours!" It was now 2 o'clock in the morning. Shooting was scheduled to begin with him at 10am, and he had hoped to have been able to test the limits of his battery and recharge before then. He moved closer to examine the screen. It was a custom-made program written to control the original Exterminatrix animatronic. It kept track of his vital statistics - battery life, internal temperature - as well as the means of inputting commands. If he put himself in sleep mode, would he charge faster?"

His robot fingers clattered against the keys - Sleep mode activate. How many times he'd wished he had this command the night before a big exam.

"Wake me up when I'm on 50%" he told her, hitting Enter.

The world flickered. Once again, he was laid on his back. He sat up and looked immediately at the clock. 05:13

Becka sat at the laptop, swaddled in a pink dressing gown, cradling a mug of thick black coffee. "Wakey wakey, sleepy head," she smiled wearily. "Fifty percent, just like you asked."

He pulled the umbilical dongle free from his belly and focused on his power. His cheap lycra skin began to bubble, gradually taking on the appearance of real metal. The changes started from his fingertips, flowing down his arms. It was only a minor cosmetic alteration but...

"Battery at 43%"

What?! He had only been going a few seconds and the changes had barely even reached his elbows. His ability really was on a very tight leash.
An easy feeling settled in the bottom of his propane tank as an unwanted thought muscled its way to the front of his mind. What if my battery doeesn't have the capacity to make my human again?

"35%," as his arms finished. By the time his torso was complete, he was "15%!" He completed his legs, moving last to his face, determined to see it through. "5%! Shawn you might want to sto-"

Next time he opened his eyes, he was in darkness...
15122121.title: Something

choices: The enginnering team that built the original robot are now in control
151221212.content:
*THUD*

His eyes flicked open but were met with only inky blackness. He was splayed out and encased completely, unable to move, the firm foam that surrounded him pressed tight against his body. He could hear voices around him and his prison gave another jolt. Fear began to take hold of him and he remembered his stuntman training, willing himself to take deep calming breaths.

His body did not respond. It was a robot, unable to breathe. His fear returned and his ability surged forward instinctively, eager to adopt a form it felt safe in. No! He quenched it desperately. If he tried to shapeshift now, his batteries would be drained and he'd be helpless.Not to mention he'd still be trapped inside this container, probably suffocating.

His encasement bounced hard off something and a male voice rang out, "Be careful with that! It's extremely expensive!"

"Not to mention explosive," a young woman's voice added with a hint of humour. Shawn couldn't put a specific face to the voice, but he recognised the sexy, self-assured tone of a Hollywood actress when he heard it. I'm on set! he thought with relief. I'm being delivered!

"Lay it down! Lay it down!" the male voice snapped. "Over here! Somebody get a crowbar and pry this thing open! Let's see what I've got to work with..."

A few more thuds and the splintering of wood later, and light flooded into his prison. His eyes adjusted slowly. He was laid on his back, encased in custom-moulded, protective black foam inside a large wooden crate. I look like a frigging barbie doll. Faces peered down at him. He made sure not to move a muscle, staring straight forward blankly, even while his peripheral vision excitedly tried to call his attention to several A-list faces it was sure it recognised. And there, standing over him with a critical look, was his director, Jamie Cameroon!

"Hmf. Not a bad copy," he sniffed.

But among the faces, Shawn could see nothing of cousin, agent, and owner, Rebecca.
151221212.title: He's in a crate being shipped to the studio

choices: "There's code in here that shouldn't be."
1512212122.content:
"Alright, get this booted up. We start rolling in twenty!" Jamie Cameroon barked, the crowd parting as he stalked off for his director's chair and latte.

Shawn's unblinking stare wavered slightly as three burly men in oil-stained overalls reached down, their callused hands wrapping around his lycra skin, pulling him up out of the protective foam casing. Slung over a shoulder, he was carried some distance and deposited on a metal workbench littered with bits of wiring. A monkey wrench the size of his arm lay within in his vision.

"Be careful with her," a nasal voice whines shrilly. It's owner enters his field of view. Whereas the previous men had most likely been mechanical engineers, this guy was unmistakably a software engineer - the physique, the glasses, the t-shirt written in binary. He leans over, for a moment his fingers tracing down Shawn's face. Shawn represses the urge to recoil. "She's very delicate."

"It's made of titanium," the mechanical engineer that carried him points out.

"But her skin is only lycra."

"Hey, relax. It's a working model, it's expected to get scratched."

"But she's our only one. If we ruin this one, we're screwed. Do you have any idea, any idea at all how much they had to pay that woman to give it to us? More than either of us make in ten years."

"Yeah, but the important thing is she sold it to us, right? So we're not renting. So we don't have to worry about returning her in one piece."

Wait, Becca sold me! How could she? Shawn was stunned. He had trusted her and she'd handed him over unconditionally. Bitterly he hoped it had been a good offer.

You're overreacting, he tried to calm himself. She knew that she could get more money with a straight-up sale and she knows that you can slip away once filming is complete. Then she'll split extra cash with you. Yet it still smarted. He had wanted her here keeping a close in case anything went wrong.

Suddenly he felt that invasive sensation penetrating into his skull again. He felt fingers on his neck. They'd plugged him in. A moment later he could hear the laptop singing in his head, his body and the computer exchanging data. Lines of text and code scrolled across his vision. He lay perfectly still, listening to the sound of fingers on the keyboard.

"That's odd..."
1512212122.title: The enginnering team that built the original ro...

choices: Exterminator 5: The Exterminatrix Rises Again 5 Years Later
15122121222.content:
"There's code in here that shouldn't be. Really weird code, but I can just delete it and work my magic from there."

Delete? What the hell does this guy think he's doing. Shawn last thought before disappearing into nothing.

____________________________________________________________________

System Error: Reinstating Original Protocols: Program Shawn: Activate

"Damn it! You dropped her! Now it's booting up, you better not hope it's broken."

"I didn't drop it! You did! You were supposed to help me!"

"You said that you 'got it' idiot. No my fault I believe you."

This was the first thing Shawn awoke to after being awoken from his involuntary slumber. It felt like just a second ago some software guy was messing with his 'code' or whatever. But that didn't matter now, he Shawn needed to figure out what was going on and fast. He felt himself being picked up with much effort, stood up against a wall, and he some dust brushed off his robotic bust. "Can't believe I'm feeling up the real Exterminatrix. It's metal but oddly flesh like, you know?" One of the two men said giving Shawn's chest a squeeze. "You know what, you're right, wonder how realistic she is 'down below' if you know what I mean." The second man said now reaching too low for Shawn's liking. Deciding he'd had enough Shawn opened his robotic mouth and said, "Too bad you won't find out." The two men had a look of absolute terror and stupidity on their faces just before Shawn knocked them out with one punch apiece.

"Now, where the hell am I? Wish I could see" Shawn said looking around. Suddenly Shawn could feel something going on inside of his eyes, and suddenly he had night vision. "Whoa, trippy." Now that he could see it only took him a glance to realize that he seemed to be in the back of a moving truck. "So I'm being shipped, fantastic. What else am I being shipped with." Shawn said as he look around the truck and saw..."Is that...me?" Shawn said at what looked like him, but on second inspection was just a cardboard cutout. "Must be for the movie. Wait a second. No, that's wrong, I was supposed to be in Exterminator 3 and that was just supposed to be a few months of shooting, what the hell happened?!" Shawn said as his eyes drew to the movie title at the bottom of the cutout.
15122121222.title: Shawn rewritten

151221212221.content:
His camera-like pupils whirred and widened in surprise at the sight of the title. Exterminator Five? Based on the usual rate that Hollywood pooped out these sequels, he estimated he had been out for no less than four years. They must have filmed the entire of Exterminator 3 with a team of engineers guiding him around like a puppet, with his 'programming' asleep inside it.

It was a disturbing thought, but he knew he should thank his guardian angel that his original mind was hard-wired in. He hadn't planned for that, so his powers must have implemented it automatically as a safety feature. Good Guy Powers.

In the dim, green-tinged night vision, he examined his surroundings closer. There were several wooden crates. Searching through them failed to yield the one thing he desperately wanted: a battery adapter.

"Okay, Shawn, calm down," he said to himself. "You've no idea how much charge you've got left - hell, you could deactive any second - but as long as you don't use your powers, we might be okay. All we gotta do is get out of here, find Becca, kick her flipping ass, and get charged up. Then change back. Simple." With that, he boldly pushed open the metal doors at the back of the lorry. "Oh..."

What he had thought was the interior of a lorry was, in fact, a shipping container. And what he had initially mistaken for the jostle of the lorry down a bumpy highway was in reality the roll of the container ship as it plowed a wind-tossed, iron-grey sea. Salt spray hit him in the face as a wave crashed over the side. There wasn't a scrap of land to be seen all the way to the horizon, only miles of water.

"That complicates things..." he gulped. "Okay, rethink... rethink... Ah ha! " he cried, snapped his lycra fingers together. Changing his whole body would drain his batteries, but if he was lucky he might have just enough to transmogrify his recharge socket into something more standard, something like a phone charger perhaps. He just needed to find any sort of charger.

He looked astern towards the ship's bridge, illuminated from within. That would be a good place to start searching. But he'd need to be stealthy...
151221212221.title: The Exterminatrix Rises Again

1512212122211.content:
Shawn moved towards the stern of ship, crouched low and concealed in the shadow of the huge stacks of shipping crates. The deck beneath him was slippery wet and every now and again the freighter would run into a powerful way or plow into a trough, and would roll and shudder violently. Shawn was grateful he didn't have a stomach to feel sea-sick with. Waves crashed over the side of the ship, and soon his lycra skin was dripping salt water.

"I really hope I'm waterproof," he muttered to himself. He doubted very much that he was bouyant and so stayed far away from the ship edge; one slip and he'd be down in Davy Jones' locker, walking to shore along the sea bed.

Just as he was about to reach the door to the crew quarters, the hand wheel began to turn. Shawn froze as the door swung open and a seaman stepped out. He was swaddled in his luminous waterproofs and had his hands cupped in front of his face as he struggled to light a cigarette - it was only that which stopped him noticing the animated gynoid skulking about on deck. He turned his back, shielding his cigarette from the high winds with his body, and Shawn took the opportunity to slip past him and inside.

He found himself in a dimly-illuminated metal corridor of a ship's interior. His lycra-padded feet made little noise as he tiptoed onward. He saw no sign of further crew members, but after a while he heard over the hum of the engines what sounded like snoring. Following the noise down, he descended a flight of stairs and came across the sleeping quarters. Four bunks were set into the walls of the tiny room and on one of them, a man was sprawled on his back, an open copy of playboy laid on his chest, his mouth open and snoring.

Shawn hesitated. The last thing he wanted in this body was to get discovered. Explaining the situation would be impossible. He'd be a stowaway. Worse, he'd be a sexualised fembot trapped on a ship of seamen unlikely to have seen a woman in weeks. He shuddered at the thought.

Except clutched in the sleeping man's hand was a phone. It was no design Shawn recognised - no doubt technology had come along in five years - but importantly it was connected to a charger plugged into the wall. Exactly what he needed.

With supreme caution he creeped forward and crouched beside the bunk. The sailor shifted in his sleep when he first tried to pry the device out of his hands, and Shawn found himself holding his breath despite not having lungs. But slowly he was able to tease the phone out from between his fingers without waking him. Elated, he removed the charger and held it up to his own recharge port in his belly button, willing his powers to conform to the female equivalent of this male dongle. He just wished he had the power remaining to do it...
1512212122211.title: Ship shapeshifter

choices: Pulling the cable from his stomach
15122121222111.content:
For a whole, terrifying minute, nothing happened and Shawn began to worry that something had gone wrong. What if his ability had deserted him or his battery was so depleted it couldn't manage even a tiny transformation like this?

But it turned out he was just a little rusty, so to speak. Slowly but surely, his recharge port began to shrink and adopt the complementary conformation of the slim phone charger. Eagerly he thrust the dongle into its place. His knees buckled.

"Oh y-yeah, that's it." His battery must have been near exhausted - recharging had felt nowhere near this good the last two times he tried it. He slumped against the wall, his eyes half-closed as the cable in his navel pumped warm, electric pleasure into his belly. "Juice me up, baby," he gasped quietly, his head buzzing, his fingers stroking the plastic cable. He bit his lip, trying to stifle the soft moans building in his throat.

The snoring had stopped. The sailor was lying with his eyes open wide, staring directly at Shawn. It was hard to feel alarmed when he felt this good, but as the man stood up and stepped closer, panic rose in him. He had barely even begun to recharge; he needed more time! He went limp as a doll, sagging against the wall with his head lolled against his shoulder and his arms unmoving at his side.

"What the fuck. Who the hell has been keeping this thing a secret?" the man chuckled, grinning broadly as he crouched over Shawn's body. "Hey, I recognise this..." The man snatched up his copy of Playboy from the bunk. He flicked it open on the centre fold. There, dressed up in raunchy underwear and sex gear and posed in a variety of compromising positions, was Shawn's body. They had done a photoshoot to promote the Exterminator 5 release, and he had been the star. The indignity! Shawn forced back the outrage as the burly sailor reached out for him...
15122121222111.title: His powers work

151221212221112.content:
"Are you ok, Miss?" he asked. Though he knew he shouldn't, Shawn's eyes widened. The sailor nodded, before looking around. Seeing no-one was there, the sailor shapeshifted. Shawn gasped when a young, attractive 5'7" olive skinned and black haired woman who had a nice curvy figure appeared in the sailor's place. "Kia Liddi, sailor and shapeshifter!" she explained. "I....I..." "You turned into a machine and can't go back right?" she sought confirmation. "Yeah!" stammered Shawn.

"Drink this! My doctor gave it to me to help me with difficult transformation. Trust me, you could drink it if you were a pen!" she exclaimed, grinning. Shawn took her word for it and drank it down. It felt weird at first, before she felt herself becoming more real. The words disappeared in front of her and she felt full of energy. Her strength felt full. "You need to change into another sailor. This guy didn't show up! Change into him!" she suggested. A quick look at the photo was all it took. Shawn was relieved that he was a human male again. "Okay, now you are Henry Watkins, 35! Just stick by me and you'll get home!" she advised as she changed into the sailor she had been.
151221212221112.title: Doing something else

1512212122211122.content:
The 6 months it took to get home was rough. More than a few times, Shawn had to change into someone else to avoid problems. Through it all, Kia was with her. Things had quickly become romantic between them, those it only happened when both Kia and Shawn were female. It had been a whirlwind experience. He was 31 years old, but he was home. "Ready to go, have a chat with your cousin?" asked Kia. Shawn had learnt that his cousin had become very wealthy off selling him. And that she had lied about what happened to him, telling his parents that he died. And this was less than 2 days after he had been sold.

She had figured out that she could make money off Shawn through more direct methods. She had betrayed him. But Rebecca didn't know what Shawn was now capable of. Shawn dropped Kia off at the hotel, they would stay in for the time being. The situation would soon change. As he walked out the door, he heard crying. He raced back to feed the triplets. Shawn Rowe could not go back to being a man. She was a mother to three beautiful children.

Rebecca Perry sipped her champagne. Since she sold her cousin to the studio, she had become wealthy and successful. Her agency had become a legitimate one, not one where she was in charge of a prima donna freak shapeshifter. She giggled to herself as she looked at the photo of her cousin. "Good luck, cousin. Wherever you are!" "Behind you!" came a chilling voice. Becky squealed when she saw her lookalike standing behind her. "Sh-Shawn! I...I'm glad you're....you're ok!" she stammered. "I'm glad to hear that, Becky!" declared Shawn, still looking like Becky.

There was a small cage in her hands. "Shawn....I know you must be mad, but I promise that" "It's ok, Becky! I always wanted a pet rat!" declared Shawn, focusing on Becky. Becky shivered before screaming. The world began growing as her hands and feet began pushing themselves into her torso. Shawn grinned at her, before picking her up. "In you go, rat!" she declared as she grabbed Becky, shoving her into the cage. "If you'll excuse me, Becky!" Shawn giggled as Becky clawed and squeaked, trying to escape.

Shawn reached for the phone. "Hi Kia, Darling! Please bring the kids, I'm Rebecca Perry now. And you, my love, are about to be my wife!" declared Shawn. Becky kept making noises, trying to get out of her cage. "Becky, I have to say that I am going to love being you. And you have 4 years to live as a rat. Good luck with that. Don't worry, I will be introducing you to a boyfriend soon!" taunted Shawn.
1512212122211122.title: return home

15122121222111222.content:
Shawn smiled as she remembered blowing out the candles. Officially she was 37, but in reality was 35. She was surrounded by her 6 children who were all sound asleep. Her wife Kia was also sleeping soundly. Shawn had turned the successful talent agency into one of the foremost recruitment agencies. She also had arranged for the adoption of no less than 98 children produced from her cousin Becky the rat and her late 3 paramours. To Shawn's delight, the babies born in 21 days, all developed human form. Once hitting 3, they could turn into rats or humanoid rats at will.

Fortunately, they were able to turn themselves back without any difficulty or fatality. She arranged for them to be adopted by various families. However Becky was ageing. She was no longer capable of breeding as she was nearing the end of her lifespan. Or so, she had thought. Shawn had given Becky's new male infant self to Shawn's own parents to be raised as the new Shawn. Shawn was uncertain how much of her treacherous cousin remained, but it didn't much matter. Becky had now redeemed herself in full, not that it mattered. She would never be able to prove what Shawn and Kia had or could do. It amused Shawn to think of Becky growing up as a boy.

Shawn was amazed at how much he had enjoyed being a talent agent. Helping talented young people achieve their goals, gifting them a helpful boost with a face change due to cosmetics of course. She no longer had any desire to be a stuntwoman. After the Exterminatrix thing, she had well and truly learnt her lesson. She snugggled up to Kia, humming to herself. Life as a wealthy, lesbian had never been better. And she had no desire to return to being Shawn Rowe, especially now that his parents had a new son.
15122121222111222.title: 4 years later

151221212221112223.content:
Shawn 'Becky Rowe' looked at the mirror. All he could see was a young man around 6 feet or 183 cms tall. Becky had endured 18 years as Shawn Rowe. She had hoped that she might develop the same powers as Shawn, so that she could at least be immune to her cousin's power. But Becky 'Shawn' Perry was 55 with 6 daughters. And all 6 of her second cousins were shapeshifters. As they showed her as they grew up. They were not aware of her past and thought that she was joking when she claimed to be Becky Perry

Becky, to her great surprise, had developed interest in women only. She suspected it was due to her upbringing with the Rowes or perhaps it was when she was kissed by a girl when she was in elementary school. The thought of men was repulsive. It made her angry to think that Shawn not only got her to be impregnated by rats, but actually changed her sexuality somehow. The fact that she slept with male rats and had babies, might also have become a factor. The Rowes were excellent and kind parents, despite the fact they were turning 75 and 73 respectively. Her original parents were also quite encouraging of her. The Rowes never revealed that she was adopted, nor did she ask.

Becky had a girlfriend, Natalie Rogers. Natalie was kind, supportive and openly bisexual. This was a great relief to Becky as she still held out hope of returning to being a woman. If she did, then she could still be with Natalie. Although Becky was a little afraid of losing her interest in women if she became one. Finding homosexual intimacy unpleasant didn't mean that lesbian relations would be viewed the same way. At least that was the hope. She had watched adult lesbian films with Natalie and was pleased that it was stimulating to both. As she stared at herself in the mirror, she tried to focus on changing herself to mirror her 18 year old self.

However all that she saw was the average size of a man in the year 2039. She sighed deeply, shaking her head. She reached for her Interpad V7. It still amazed her that Tim Cook had arranged for the Apple-Microsoft Merger with Steve Ballmer that led to the first Interpad in 2025. Steve Balmer died in 2038 at the age of 82 from Thermal Radiation as part of the disastrous Venus Expedition which remained the larger space disaster in Human History. She opened her Interpad and separated the communication component. To think that hardware could integrate physically was still amazing. A person could have a laptop, Ipad, Iphone, PC, external hard drive, Ipod, Zune, smartphone, bicycle and aeronautical terrain vehicle all in one device with a wristwatch with GPS linked by bluetooth to ensure it never got lost.

"Hi darling, its Shawn! Listen I am at my apartment working on my novel! Could you come over? I don't have class until this afternoon!" declared Becky. "Of course, my tiger! I'll be right there!" squealed Natalie, excitedly. She was always excited. Becky beamed before her eyes widened. Her hands....they were thinner with red nail polish! Dainty like....they used to be.
151221212221112223.title: Becky's new 'Shawn' life

154.content:
"It's not a dog and the money is good, but-" There was always a but. "-it is an animal."

Shawn groaned. "You do know you're running a casting agency, right? Not a zoo."

"I know, I'm sorry," Rebecca said despondently down the phone. "This wasn't what you were expecting when you came to LA; it's certainly not what I was expecting - I mean, obviously. But we're getting there, Shawn! Just think of this as one more rung on the ladder, then they're bound to start giving us real parts"

"Any kids with hockey sticks in this one?"

"None."

"Well that's something. So tell me, what animal am I to be playing?"

He heard Becca give a squeal of glee down the phone at his glimmer of consent. "Well they're looking to cast a..."
154.title: Animal actors

choices: Rebecca scoops him into a little plastic box
1542.content:
Focusing on eight legs at once wasn't easy but Shawn was gradually getting the hang of it. Slowly he scuttled across the coffee table, a tiny Black Widow spider moving with a somewhat drunken gait. The glass beneath him seemed to stretch out as huge as a football field. He had never once tried a form this small before and he couldn't say he was exactly comfortable with it.

His eight eyes spaced around his head watched every part of the room at once. Both the body's instincts and his own concerns made sure he paid special attention to the human. From this angle, Becca seemed vast, literally miles high. When she spoke, her voice was like a foghorn. When she moved, the movement of air felt like a powerful gale howling over the sensitive hairs that coated his abdomen and many legs.

The ceiling light was blocked out as Rebecca's huge head moved closer and hovered over him, like a pink meteor that could crash down and crush him any second. Shawn tried to scuttle out from under her, finding his animal panic overrode his clumsy human control of his legs, allowing him to scuttle more freely. Alas, she followed him around the coffee table, peering at him, her nostrils not more than a few inches away, pumping out hot blasts of air.

"Wow, Shawn, you're really picking it up now!" Rebecca boomed excitedly. "If I didn't know any better I'd swear you were the real thing. I'd probably have smooshed you by now!" He wished she wouldn't use that word: smooshed. "So you're probably wondering what the film is by now, right?" She paused, as if expecting him to answer. "It's a remake of Arachnophobia, y'know the old 90s film. I know you're gonna love it because they've really sleazed it up, kinda like the Piranha franchise. Something about a crate of poisonous spiders washing ashore at spring break. Basically an excuse for close up shots of you scuttling over teenagers racks."

Shawn hesitated. He wasn't sure if this sounded like such a good job after all. Sure stuntwork was supposed to be risky, but being such a small creature in close proximity to a bunch of twitchy teenage girls was suicide. He was just about to will the shift back to human form when...
1542.title: Spider

choices: Shawn is taken straight to filming
Shawn is placed in a cage with other spiders first
15421.content:
To hell with this, I'm shifting back before somebody stands on me- WHOAAA!" Rebecca's hand slid like an advancing pink wall across the coffee table, scooping him up and sweeping him into a small (even for his size) plastic cube. The lid snapped shit on top, sealing him in the box.

What the hell Becca?

"That's enough training for now. We've got to get you to the shoot," she boomed.

No, I need to change back now! He visualised his human form, willing it to alter his body to fit... Nothing happened. It's the box, he thought in dismay. If I transformed now I'd be crushed, my powers must be protecting me. He pressed his front two legs against the plastic wall, searching for a gap. There was nothing. The prison lurched suddenly, tumbling him off the walls and floor. When he picked himself up, he wasn't even sure which surface was the lid anymore. Looks like I'm committed, he sighed as she slipped him inside her purse.

He traveled in darkness for what felt like hours, clicking his mandibles nervously with each bump and knock. As light flooded back in, he stared around at the world around him.

Hot damn. I wish I had ten eyes, Shawn drooled (or at least leaked venom). Everywhere he looked - which, with 360 degree vision, happened to be everywhere at once - there were bikini clad beauties. He was in an interior film set. There was a painted, blue sky backdrop, wind machines, and golden sand spread across the floor to emulate a beach. Bronzed, toned teenage bodies skipped hither and thither beneath the light rigging, as a team of make-up artists touched up their make-up, fluffed their hair, sprayed fake tan on their butts, and sellotaped the strapless bikini tops to their breasts. Shawn was in heaven.

"Having fun in there?" Rebecca chuckled, as the Shawn-spider scuttled back and forth in its box, ogling each actress as they passed by. "Ah, here comes your handler now."

Shawn's excitement dwindled as his box was exchanged into the hands of a middle-aged woman in khaki. He was raised up to eyeline and peered at by a weatherbeaten, sunburnt face. "Cor, she's a real beaut. Look at the markings." Australian. Naturally.

"She's one of a kind alright," Rebecca replied. "Take good care of her."

"Don't you worry about her, little miss. If there's one creature you don't wanna piss off, it's a latrodectus. By the sounds of things it's only gonna be a couple of shots, so you should have her back by tomorrow."
15421.title: Rebecca scoops him into a little plastic box

choices: Shooting is over for the day. Rebecca collects him tomorrow
Shooting takes longer than expected. Shawn must eat.
154211.content:
"Just keep perfectly still. It won't bite if you don't move."

"Alright, cameras rolling in 5...4...3...2...1...Action!"

That's right, keep perfectly still, Shawn thought as he stood on a pink hill, his eight legs splayed on the warm, gently rising-and-falling ground beneath him. He hadn't been intending to go through with it at first but as the handler carried him towards the set and he saw the actress laid out on the sand, he'd changed his mind. She wasn't an actress, she was a stuntwoman like him ( except he was a stuntman of course (well, usually anyway)), and that had allowed him to trust her not to smoosh him in a pique of girlish terror. He'd actually met her once at a stunt-training workshop a year ago. Back then she'd been a B-cup and pretty cute. Somewhere along the line she'd upgraded to a pair of DDs and fallen in a vat of peroxide. God, I hope she didn't get implants just for this role. That'd be depressing, Shawn thought. Then he reconsidered who was really the more desperate for work here: the woman who had altered her body, or the man who had changed it into another species entirely.

Right now, he was perched on her right boob. All he had to do was walk across her cleavage and he'd be done. It seemed simple enough. The only difficulty was that the girl was practically drenched in fake tan and the hot, set lights (not to mention his precarious, poisonous presence) was making her sweat buckets. It was like walking through a muddy field. All around him, beads of perspiration the size of his head were forming on her skin. He lifted his legs through the greasy sludge one at a time, moving ponderously down the slope of her breast. Down in the valley of her cleavage, he stared up at the mountain before him.

One foot after the next, after the next, after the next, after the next, after the next, after the next, after the next. Halfway up, he knew he wasn't going to make it, the strain was exhausting his long, spindly legs. He forged southward, clambering onto the dry fabric of her bikini top. This was much easier going. From here it was an easy climb to the summit. He paused at the top, feeling a surge of achievement, and giggled mentally as he realised where he was standing. Her nipple stuck out like a cairn through the thin material. To her credit, the girl continued to lie still on the sand with her eyes closed even as his legs tickled her areola.

The cameras were still rolling. Shawn descending the flank of Mount Stuntgirl for a second time. As he neared the edge of her body, he heard the shout of "CUT!" The Australian woman was there in an instant, scooping him deftly into a plastic container. The stuntgirl let out a shuddering, pent-up gasp, grinning madly, her hands roving over her breasts for puncture marks, just in case. "That was terrifying!" she shrieked shakily.

"Hey now, she wouldn't hurt a fly," the handler chuckled, tapping the side of Shawn's container. "Well maybe just a fly."

Speaking of, Shawn was hoping the shoot would be over before he had to feed. Already he could feel his stomach was empty. Just a few more shots and he'd be human again and tucking into a nice, juicy hamburger.
154211.title: Shawn is taken straight to filming

1542112.content:
"I was told filming would only take a day," Rebecca said worriedly. "That was three days ago."

"Who told you that?" the production manager asked sharply. "We're working with animals here, God help us, it takes as long as it takes. Look, you're still getting paid for the insect. If you needed your bug back so soon you should have specified it in your contract."

"I just... I just need to check on it's well-being is all," she pleads. "Is that the cage there?" she asks, peeking beneath the manager's armpit into the interior of the set. Before he can stop her, she ducks beneath his arm, hurrying to the large, perspex box set aside from the cameras. Gravel lined the bottom of the tank and the few leafy branches placed inside it had been festooned with spider silk. She spotted a few spiders lurking among the shadows of the leaves, but none that resembled Shawn.

"It's this one, right?" the manager said tersely, wandering over to the tank and tapping the glass in one of the corners. "Looks, it's doing fine. It's even got a little nest."

Becca peered closer. It was a Black Widow alright, though she couldn't know for sure that it was him. It sat hunched-up in the middle of the most craptastic spider web she'd ever seen. It looked like the arachnid had gotten entangled itself several times. Broken strands of silk clung to it's bulbous, black abdomen. Yet somehow, something had become caught in the crude construction. A greenbottle fly thrashed its legs and wings helplessly. "If that's him, he's going to kill me for this," she groaned as the spider sank it's fangs into the struggling insect. He still whined at her about the time he'd eaten garbage as a concussed dog. This was even worse.

"Happy?" the manager snapped. "If it's all fine with you I've got a job to do."

"Wait, what's that other one doing," Becca said, pointing to a smaller, brown-bodied spider that was approaching the Black Widow's corner.

"That one? That's the male. It keeps trying to get with the female, but everu time it steps in her web she cases him off. I'm surprised she hasn't bitten his head off yet."

The brown spider made a timid attempt to mount the abdomen of the widow. She whipped around, throwing it off her, and chased it away across the tank, waving its front legs in the air in a distinctly human gesture of anger.
------------
It's almost flattering really, Shawn thought as he returned to his web, confident that the brown spider would not dare return for a few hours. Ever since he'd been placed in here with the other spiders, it had pursued him relentless, doing mating dances into the early hours, bringing him flies to eat, acting all nicey-nicey right up to the point that it whipped out its freakish alien penis and tried to mount him. Is it my fault? Am I leading him on? Did I pick a really skanky-looking spider body to switch into? It's my abdomen, isn't it... Shawn thought, glancing back at his big, black rear. Slightly smug at how sexy a spider he was, Shawn climbed back into his, if he did say so himself, pretty awesome web.

That was when he realised the human voices he could hear were coming from nearby. He'd spent so long in the hubbub of the set that he'd just fazed them out. He stared upwards, upwards, uuuupwards, through the plexiglass to the two behemoth figures on the other side. It was Becca! She'd come to rescue him! Finally he was going home!

"Can you at least give me a date?"

The other human walked away from the tank, throwing up his arms in defeat. "Fine, Ms Perry. We should have finished shooting-"
1542112.title: Shooting takes longer than expected. Shawn must...

choices: 2 Weeks Later something happens with an actress
2 Weeks Later something happens in the spider cage
15421122.content:
"A month!" Rebecca said stunned. "But this was just a shoot for a few days. You're making a smutty B movie. What a month?"

The manager huffed and said, "We aren't just making one film, after the quick success thanks to your black widow, we were quickly greenlit for Arachnophobia II: Arachnids, Arachnids II: The Arachniding, ArachniDDs, and ArachniDDs II: The Double DDquil."

Rebecca couldn't believe what she was hearing. "This has been a gross breach of trust. I did not sign up for that. I signed a one film deal. Now I'm going to take my spider and go...what is that?" Rebecca asked as the producer showed her a piece of paper.

"It is indeed in your contract that we can choose to make 4 more movies with your spider, along with a pay raise." The producer said pointing out a figure at the bottom of the contract.

Rebecca forgot her rage and was just stunned, "That many zero's? For a month? For a spider?"

"It's a very good spider Ms. Perry. Now please stop making a scene and leave."

Rebecca stammered, "I will, I guess. Just please go get me a copy of the new contract with the new pay scale."

The producer rolled his eyes and goes to a copier, Rebecca uses this opportunity to bend down by the cage and whispered to Shawn, "I'm sorry but you're going to have to be like this for another month. I'm so so so sorry, but the pay will be worth it and I promise I'll only take 5% instead of the usual 10%. Take care." Becca said as she took the freshly copied contract and left the studio.
____________
A month!? She couldn't have just said a month. Tell me she didn't say a month! Shawn thought to himself. He'd heard the producers talk about how they'd get more movies out of this, but he didn't think he'd be the spider still around for them. As he thought this the brown spider dropped off another fly for him and tried to make it's moves again. And with my luck you'll be my roommate the whole time, great. Shawn once again waved his front legs in a way that scared the male brown spider off, but Shawn knew that his flailing arm move was getting less effect each time. It's going to be a long month. Shawn said as he dug his spider fangs into the fly.
15421122.title: "-by next month."

info.brief_description: A stuntman uses his power to get cast as a stuntman...or stuntwoman...or about anything
info.description:
Now over 175 chapters and approaching 10,000 views! Thanks to all who have been a part of this.

Shawn Rowe 25 year old man in California pursuing his dream to become a big time Hollywood stuntman. And Shawn's got an advantage that nobody else has; he can reshape his body to anything he wants. As you can imagine, this would make him a highly coveted commodity. That's why he works through his agent/cousin Rebecca who gets him the best jobs possible (or whatever happens to come across her desk). The two have only done work with smaller budget films up to this point, but their fortunes are about to change.

Main characters (so far):
Shawn Rowe- 25 year old shapeshifting stuntman. His 'default' look is that of a 5' 9" guy of average size who's in pretty good conditioning due to his job. He's outgoing and will take just about any job offered to him, for better or for worse. He keeps his powers a secret from everyone except his agent in order to prevent himself from becoming some government experiment.

Rebecca Perry- 27 year old agent. Cousin of Shawn. She moved to California with the dreams of becoming an agent but after years of interning she found she was getting nowhere, when practically out of the blue Shawn reveals his powers to her. She immediately quit her job and started up her own agency with Shawn is every single client. Whenever a studio needs a stuntperson they call her up and she 'just so happens' to have a near perfect duplicate of the actor/actress on file.

Rules:
1. Keep additions more than just a quick sentence or two, have a little substance to what you write. Aim for at least 1000 characters.

2. No matter what role or shape Shawn takes, his mind does not change. He will always be Shawn Rowe, no brainwashing, hormones taking over, instinctual changes, or just random personality shifts in general. Shawn stays Shawn in mind and heart, a 25 year old heterosexual male.

3. Have good grammar and spelling, although I might not be the best judge of that (do as I say not as I do)

4. No rated X stuff please.

Iâll award GPs for good chapters.

Letâs have fun with this.
